text: 13.13 Recent London-wide vulnerability mapping [11] indicates that Tower Hamlets is at increased risk of flooding and overheating as a direct result of a changing climate. New development must be planned, designed, and constructed to respond to future anticipated changes in climate, such as warmer winters and hotter summers, and the risks associated with such changes, including increased likelihood of extreme weather events such as droughts, heatwaves, intense rainfall, and flooding. Tower Hamlets Local Plan 107 CLEAN AND GREEN FUTURE 13.14 In recognition of the borough’s areas of flood risk, more vulnerable development should be located away from these areas, as shown on the Policies Map.
